data.title: 2024 Arkansas Football Roster Tracker: Who Stays, Who Goes
data.meta_description: Keeping up with all of the offseason movement on the Arkansas football roster can be hard, so let us do it for you!
data.text:
Arkansas Football

Razorback News

Arkansas Roster Tracker for 2024: Who’s Staying, Who’s Going

By

Andrew Hutchinson

-

It is once again time to track all of the movement on the Arkansas football roster.

Head coach Sam Pittman said he doesn’t anticipate things being quite as wild this year as it was following the 2022 season, but there will still be quite a few players leaving and several more added — both via the transfer portal.

Keeping track of it all, and how close the Razorbacks are to the 85-man scholarship limit imposed by the NCAA, can be difficult, so Best of Arkansas Sports decided to do all of the hard work for you.

Bookmark this link so you can always check how things stand this offseason, as we’ll be updating this as news breaks…

*walk-on

^newcomer (high school, JUCO, portal commits/signees)

Quarterback

Timeline

April 9: Four-star quarterback KJ Jackson out of St. James School in Montgomery, Ala., has committed to Arkansas.

Nov. 29: According to reports by 247Sports, KJ Jefferson plans to enter the transfer portal. However, he quickly refuted that report, saying he hadn’t made a decision yet.

Dec. 11: Arkansas’ third transfer portal addition is quarterback Taylen Green from Boise State.

Dec. 16: After plenty of speculation, KJ Jefferson finally announced he was entering the transfer portal. Click here to read his final message to Arkansas fans.

Dec. 21: Right-handed pitcher Austin Ledbetter announced he was leaving the baseball team and joining the football team. He was a standout quarterback at Bryant High School. He’ll be a walk-on.

April 13: Walk-on Rykar Acebo is still listed as a quarterback on the roster, but he lined up at wide receiver in the Red-White spring game and even caught a few passes.

April 15: Multiple reports have come out that Jacolby Criswell will enter the transfer portal.

April 30: Coastal Carolina transfer Blake Boda has transferred to Arkansas, once again giving it four scholarship quarterbacks.

Malachi Singleton — redshirt freshman

^Blake Boda — redshirt freshman (transfer from Coastal Carolina)

*^Austin Ledbetter — redshirt junior

*Rykar Acebo — redshirt sophomore

Leaving the Program

Cade Fortin — out of eligibility

KJ Jefferson — transfer portal (potential super senior)

Jacolby Criswell — transfer portal

Running Back

Timeline

Nov. 6, 2021: Four-star running back Braylen Russell, then at Hot Springs Lakeside, announced his commitment to the Razorbacks after their dramatic win over Mississippi State, becoming Arkansas’ earliest commitment on record.

Oct. 9, 2022: About one year later, Russell backed off his pledge following a blowout loss at Mississippi State.

May 19: Four-star athlete Jadan Baugh out of Columbia High School in Decatur, Ga., announced his commitment to Arkansas. He is projected to play running back.

July 14: Russell got back on board by re-committing to the Razorbacks.

Dec. 4: After three seasons in the Arkansas football program, AJ Green announced he would pursue other opportunities for his final year of eligibility by entering the transfer portal.

Dec. 5: Following an injury-plagued junior season, Rocket Sanders announced he will enter the transfer portal for his final season of college football instead of declaring for the NFL Draft.

Dec. 18: After taking official visits to Florida and Alabama, Jadan Baugh announced he was de-committing from the Razorbacks.

Jan. 5: Arkansas added a veteran presence to its running back room by landing Ja’Quinden Jackson from Utah via the transfer portal.

April 13: A few hours after the Razorbacks’ annual Red-White spring game, Isaiah Augustave announced he would be entering the transfer portal.

April 19: Transfer running back Rodney Hill has committed to Arkansas. He spent the previous two seasons at Florida State, but briefly transferred to Florida A&M before re-entering the portal during the spring window.

April 29: Dominique Johnson has entered the transfer portal after four seasons with the Razorbacks.

Tight End

Timeline

Nov. 29: If there was any doubt about Luke Hasz’s future with the Razorbacks, he silenced it with a tweet that said, “Year 2. Excited to be back. Blessed to call Fayetteville home.”

Nov. 29: Walk-on tight end Hunter Talley, a converted quarterback from Siloam Springs, entered the transfer portal.

Nov. 30: Arkansas doesn’t have any high school tight ends committed in the 2024 class, but did land a pledge from Dodge City C.C. tight end Greg Genross.

Dec. 4: There had been rumors about Ty Washington possibly hitting the transfer portal, but he indicated via Twitter that he’d return to Arkansas in 2024.

Dec. 10: The second transfer addition of the cycle is Andreas Paaske from Eastern Michigan. Click here for our analysis of how he fits with the Razorbacks.

Dec. 12: Genross’ commitment to Arkansas lasted less than two weeks, as he announced his de-commitment via Twitter.

Jan. 18: Best of Arkansas Sports has learned that Francis Sherman will not return as a super senior in 2024.

Wide Receiver

Timeline

April 21: Pine Bluff wide receiver Courtney Crutchfield, a top-100 overall recruit on some sites, committed to Arkansas.

June 15: Three-star wide receiver CJ Brown, an in-state product from Bentonville, committed to Arkansas.

July 4: Four-star wide receiver Ashton Bethel-Roman out of Ridge Point High School in Missouri City, Texas, committed to Arkansas.

Nov. 4: Crutchfield backed off his commitment moments before kickoff of the Florida game.

Nov. 27: Best of Arkansas Sports learned that sophomore Sam Mbake was dismissed from the team a few weeks earlier.

Nov. 29: Walk-on wide receiver Chris Rhodes, who originally came to Arkansas as a defensive back from Iowa Western C.C., has entered the transfer portal.

Dec. 1: Walk-on wide receiver Kalil Girault has entered the transfer portal.

Dec. 7: After three seasons at Arkansas, Bryce Stephens has entered the transfer portal. He hardly played in 2023, so it is not much of a surprising decision.

Dec. 8: The wide receiver room got a huge boost when leading receiver Andrew Armstrong announced he’d return to Arkansas for his super senior season.

Dec. 9: The following day, Arkansas got another boost when Isaac TeSlaa announced he’d use his super senior season in 2024. Click here for our breakdown of the impact of Armstrong and TeSlaa returning in 2024.

Dec. 15: Walk-on wide receiver Chris Harris has entered the transfer portal.

Dec. 20: After losing Courtney Crutchfield to Missouri, the Razorbacks zeroed in on Kross Johnson, a wide receiver from New Orleans, as his replacement in the 2024 recruiting class.

Dec. 20: Missouri and Texas A&M pushed hard to flip him, but Ashton Bethel-Roman eventually signed with Arkansas on the first day of the early signing period. He was the Razorbacks’ last signee of the day.

Dec. 20: Arkansas has landed a preferred walk-on commitment from Cam Wright, a wide receiver out of South Panola High School in Batesville, Miss., who began his career at Memphis before transferring to East Mississippi C.C.

Dec. 26: Walk-on wide receiver Marlon Crockett, who transferred in from Memphis last offseason, has entered the transfer portal again.

Jan. 2: Arkansas picked up a speedy wide receiver from the transfer portal in Jordan Anthony from Texas A&M, who immediately becomes one of the fastest players on the team.

Jan. 10: About a month after entering it, Bryce Stephens has withdrawn from the transfer portal. It’s a somewhat surprising decision, as he gives Arkansas 11 scholarship wide receivers (12 if Broden returns), but he’s another speedster at the Hogs’ disposal.

Jan. 18: Best of Arkansas Sports has confirmed Tyrone Broden will also return to school as a super senior.

Feb. 1: Four-star signee Ashton Bethel-Roman has been released from his letter of intent, Best of Arkansas Sports has learned.

Offensive Line

Timeline

June 26: Kobe Branham, an in-state prospect out of Fort Smith Southside, committed to Arkansas.

June 27: A day after landing its first, Arkansas picked up another offensive line commitment, this time from Zuri Madison out of Frederick Douglass High School in Lexington, Ky.

Aug. 30: Arkansas successfully flipped Stanford four-star offensive line commit Kai Greer out of Marvin Ridge High School in Waxhaw, N.C.

Nov. 20: The first transfer portal commitment of the cycle for Arkansas football came from former Michigan State offensive lineman Keyshawn Blackstock. Click here to see how he fits in with the Razorbacks.

Nov. 29: Brock Burns, a walk-on from Ozark, Ark., has announced he is medically retiring from football.

Dec. 4: Despite starting the final three games of 2023 at left tackle, Devon Manuel has entered the transfer portal instead of returning for a fourth season at Arkansas.

Dec. 4: In the wake of offensive line coach Cody Kennedy leaving to take the Mississippi State job, Greer announced he decommitted from the Razorbacks.

Dec. 11: Ty’Kieast Crawford announced via Twitter that he’d “run it back” with Arkansas as a super senior in 2024.

Dec. 13: After just one season at Arkansas, Joey Su’a has opted to enter the transfer portal.

Dec. 15: Arkansas landed one of the top offensive tackles in the transfer portal when San Jose State left tackle Fernando Carmona Jr. announced his pledge.

Jan. 6: Less than three weeks after announcing he was “back” from the torn pectoral injury that kept him out all of 2023, Terry Wells announced he was medically retiring.

Jan. 12: In-state product Tim Dawn has committed to Arkansas as a preferred walk-on. He’s a transfer from Baylor.

Jan. 17: Best of Arkansas Sports has learned that Eli Henderson will receive a medical hardship, ending his career with the Razorbacks.

Jan. 17: Best of Arkansas Sports has learned that Cole Carson is set to graduate this spring and will move on from the program despite being a redshirt sophomore in 2023.

Jan. 18: Best of Arkansas Sports has confirmed that Beaux Limmer is entering the NFL Draft, as expected, and also learned that Brady Latham won’t return as a super senior.

March 5: Sam Pittman announced that Andrew Chamblee was no longer on the team because he had “lost the love for the game” and would begin his career as a regular student.

March 29: Despite what Pittman said a few weeks earlier, Chamblee will enter the transfer portal when it opens in April, Best of Arkansas Sports has learned.

April 20: After spending pretty much the entire spring running with the third-team unit, redshirt freshman Paris Patterson opted to hit the transfer portal. He spent just one season with the Razorbacks.

April 29: The Razorbacks dipped into the transfer portal again by landing Joe More, who played last year at Syracuse after five years at the FCS level at Richmond. He’ll be a seventh-year super senior.

Defensive Line

Timeline

Nov. 6, 2022: Four-star defensive end Kavion Henderson out of Leeds, Ala., committed to Arkansas over an extensive offer list.

April 21: Four-star defensive end Charleston Collins, an in-state standout at Little Rock Mills, committed to Arkansas.

Dec. 4: Rather than returning to Arkansas for a super senior season, defensive tackle Taurean Carter entered the transfer portal and will finish his career elsewhere.

Dec. 6: Landon Jackson announced he is returning for the 2024 season.

Dec. 12: Rather than returning to Arkansas as a super senior, Anthony “Tank” Booker Jr. announced he was entering the transfer portal.

Dec. 14: Potential super senior Jashaud Stewart has been suspended indefinitely following an arrest on residential burglary and first-degree criminal mischief charges. Click here for our story about his arrest.

Jan. 5: The Razorbacks’ trio of portal commits on Jan. 5 was capped by defensive end Anton Juncaj from Albany.

Jan. 18: Best of Arkansas Sports has learned that defensive tackles Eric Gregory and Keivie Rose are returning as super seniors, but Marcus Miller is not. Also, Jashaud Stewart’s status (indefinitely suspended) has not changed, which tells us he is still on the team as of now.

March 7: Jashaud Stewart is not listed on Arkansas’ spring roster, indicating he is no longer on the team.

April 8: Jashaud Stewart announced he plans to enter the transfer portal later in the month. He has a super senior season available.

Linebacker

Timeline

April 8: Four-star athlete Julius “JuJu” Pope out of South Panola High School in Batesville, Miss., committed to Arkansas. He’s projected to play linebacker for the Razorbacks.

Aug. 2: Four-star linebacker Justin Logan out of Kell High School in Marietta, Ga., committed to Arkansas.

Aug. 19: The Razorbacks managed to keep Wyatt Simmons, a high three-star in-state recruit out of Harding Academy, home by landing his pledge.

Nov. 27: The first surprising announcement of the offseason came courtesy of linebacker Chris “Pooh” Paul Jr., who is entering the transfer portal. A former Arkansas tight end provided some insight into why he made that decision.

Nov. 28: A day after Paul’s announcement, linebacker Jordan Crook made a similar one. He likely would have had an inside track to start in 2024 had he returned.

Dec. 2: After two seasons with the Razorbacks in which he mainly contributed on special teams, Mani Powell announced he will enter the transfer portal.

Dec. 7: After spending one year at Wake Forest, Brooks Yurachek announced he is transferring back home to Arkansas. The youngest son of athletics director Hunter Yurachek, he is a preferred walk-on for the Razorbacks. He played his high school ball just down the road at Fayetteville.

Dec. 19: Former five-star recruit Xavian Sorey Jr. announced he was transferring to Arkansas.

Dec. 25: He secretly signed with the Razorbacks during the early signing period, but four-star recruit Bradley Shaw didn’t announce his commitment publicly until Christmas.

Dec. 30: Jaheim Thomas, who transferred in from Cincinnati last offseason and led the Razorbacks in tackles in 2023, is the fourth scholarship linebacker to enter the transfer portal.

April 20: Not long after hosting him on an official visit, the Razorbacks landed a commitment from Larry Worth III, a transfer from Jacksonville State.

April 30: Arkansas has landed a commitment from Stephen Dix Jr., a linebacker transfer from Marshall who began his career at Florida State.

Defensive Back

Timeline

March 13: Four-star athlete Noreel White out of St. Martin High School in Ocean Springs, Miss., committed to Arkansas. He was expected to play defensive back for the Razorbacks.

April 21: Four-star defensive back Jaden Allen out of Aledo, Texas, committed to Arkansas. He was previously committed to Texas, where his older brother plays.

April 22: Three-star defensive back Tevis Metcalf, the younger brother of current freshman T.J. Metcalf, committed to Arkansas. He plays at Clay-Chalkville High School in Pinson, Ala.

June 14: The Razorbacks added to their secondary class by landing a commitment from three-star athlete Ahkhari Johnson from Pleasant Grove High School in Texarkana, Texas. He’s projected to play defensive back.

July 14: Perhaps the biggest recruiting coup of the class has been landing four-star defensive back Selman Bridges from Lake Belton High School in Temple, Texas.

July 31: Three-star athlete Jeremy Cook from Hoover, Ala., committed to Arkansas. He’s projected to play defensive back for the Razorbacks.

Aug. 1: After several months of speculation, White decommitted from Arkansas and eventually flipped to Ole Miss, which was recruiting him as a wide receiver.

Nov. 22: The first Arkansas football player to announce his intention to enter the transfer portal this cycle was reserve defensive back Jaylen Lewis, who did so the week of the Mississippi State game.

Dec. 6: Malik Chavis has opted to enter the transfer portal for his final year of eligibility. He will be a super senior in 2024.

Dec. 15: Former Tennessee defensive back Doneiko Slaughter committed to Arkansas out of the transfer portal. He gave a unique reason for his decision.

Dec. 19: A source has told Best of Arkansas Sports that Dwight McGlothern is definitely declaring for the NFL Draft and not returning as a super senior. That was expected because he had already accepted an invitation to the East-West Shrine Bowl.

Dec. 20: Sam Pittman revealed that Julius “JuJu” Pope is currently penciled in on the depth chart as a nickel, so we have moved him from linebacker to here.

Dec. 20: Best of Arkansas Sports has learned that defensive back Jeremy Cook, who committed on July 31, is not signing with the Razorbacks.

Jan 5: Following his official visit to Fayetteville, South Alabama transfer cornerback Marquise Robinson committed to Arkansas.

Jan. 12: The Razorbacks have added yet another defensive back from the transfer portal, landing former Florida safety Miguel Mitchell. Click here for a breakdown of what he brings to the table.

Jan. 17: Best of Arkansas Sports has learned that cornerback Quincey McAdoo will receive a medical hardship, ending his career with the Razorbacks.

Jan. 18: Best of Arkansas Sports has learned that Hudson Clark and Kee’yon Stewart are returning as super seniors in 2024.

March 14: Quincey McAdoo publicly announced that he is medically retiring.

April 22: In a somewhat surprising move, Lorando “Snaxx” Johnson has entered the transfer portal. However, if you dig deeper, it isn’t quite as surprising.

April 26: Although he’s played both linebacker and safety during his career, Anthony Switzer – an Arkansas native – committed to Arkansas as a nickel. He’s a transfer from Utah State who began his career at Arkansas State.

April 30: After just one year at Arkansas, RJ Johnson has decided to enter the transfer portal.

Special Teams

Timeline

Sept. 4: Sam Pittman announced that former kicker Vito Calvaruso, who transferred to Wisconsin after two seasons with the Razorbacks from 2020-21, was back with the program. As a second-time transfer, he had to sit out the 2023 season, but should have two years of eligibility remaining.

Dec. 1: In somewhat of a rare move, Cam Little has declared for the NFL Draft as a true junior.

Dec. 1: Walk-on kicker/punter Tyler Larco, who transferred in from UT Martin, has re-entered the transfer portal.

Dec. 1: Walk-on punter Owen Lawson, who transferred in from Coffeyville C.C., has entered the transfer portal.

Dec. 10: The first known preferred walk-on commit from the high school ranks in the 2024 class is Sam Dubwig, a standout punter from Cabot.

Dec. 17: The Razorbacks found their replacement for Little by landing Matthew Shipley from Hawaii via the transfer portal.

Jan. 2: Walk-on kicker Blake Ford has entered the transfer portal.

April 18: In one of the more surprising post-spring moves at Arkansas in a while, punter Max Fletcher hit the transfer portal a few days after the conclusion of spring ball. Click here for our story on what it means for the Hogs.
